questiontext.text:
Here is a diagram of a transformation.
The blue shape has been enlarged into the red shape.


[[jsxgraph height="500px" width="500px"]] var largeCoord1 = [{#first(largeCen)+first(largeOri)#},{#second(largeCen)+second(largeOri)#}]; var largeCoord2 = [{#first(largeCen)+(if abs(first(largeOri))=3 then -first(largeOri) else first(largeOri))#},{#second(largeCen)+(if abs(second(largeOri))=3 then -second(largeOri) else second(largeOri))#}]; var cenPoint = {#tans2#}; var scaleFact = {#tans1#}; var smallCoord1 = [ cenPoint[0]*(1-1/scaleFact)+largeCoord1[0]/scaleFact, cenPoint[1]*(1-1/scaleFact)+largeCoord1[1]/scaleFact, ]; var smallCoord2 = [ cenPoint[0]*(1-1/scaleFact)+largeCoord2[0]/scaleFact, cenPoint[1]*(1-1/scaleFact)+largeCoord2[1]/scaleFact, ]; JXG.Options.text.useMathJax=true; var board = JXG.JSXGraph.initBoard(divid, { boundingBox:[-7,7,7,-7], showCopyright:false, showNavigation:false, keepaspectratio:true, axis:true }); // Small Shape var p1 = board.create("point", smallCoord1, {visible:false}); var p2 = board.create("point", smallCoord2, {visible:false}); var pointList = [ p1, p2, [p2.X()-(p1.Y()-p2.Y())/3, p2.Y()+(p1.X()-p2.X())/3], [ p2.X()+(p1.X()-p2.X())/3-(p1.Y()-p2.Y())/3, p2.Y()+(p1.X()-p2.X())/3+(p1.Y()-p2.Y())/3 ], [ p2.X()+(p1.X()-p2.X())/3-2*(p1.Y()-p2.Y())/3, p2.Y()+2*(p1.X()-p2.X())/3+(p1.Y()-p2.Y())/3 ], [ p1.X()-(p1.X()-p2.X())/3-2*(p1.Y()-p2.Y())/3, p1.Y()+2*(p1.X()-p2.X())/3-(p1.Y()-p2.Y())/3 ], [ p1.X()-(p1.X()-p2.X())/3-(p1.Y()-p2.Y())/3, p1.Y()+(p1.X()-p2.X())/3-(p1.Y()-p2.Y())/3 ], [p1.X()-(p1.Y()-p2.Y())/3, p1.Y()+(p1.X()-p2.X())/3] ]; board.create("polygon", pointList, { fixed:true, highlight:false, fillColor:"blue", borders:{ fixed:true, highlight:false, strokeColor:"blue" }, vertices:{ visible:false } }); // Large Shape var p3 = board.create("point", largeCoord1, {visible:false}); var p4 = board.create("point", largeCoord2, {visible:false}); var pointList = [ p3, p4, [p4.X()-(p3.Y()-p4.Y())/3, p4.Y()+(p3.X()-p4.X())/3], [ p4.X()+(p3.X()-p4.X())/3-(p3.Y()-p4.Y())/3, p4.Y()+(p3.X()-p4.X())/3+(p3.Y()-p4.Y())/3 ], [ p4.X()+(p3.X()-p4.X())/3-2*(p3.Y()-p4.Y())/3, p4.Y()+2*(p3.X()-p4.X())/3+(p3.Y()-p4.Y())/3 ], [ p3.X()-(p3.X()-p4.X())/3-2*(p3.Y()-p4.Y())/3, p3.Y()+2*(p3.X()-p4.X())/3-(p3.Y()-p4.Y())/3 ], [ p3.X()-(p3.X()-p4.X())/3-(p3.Y()-p4.Y())/3, p3.Y()+(p3.X()-p4.X())/3-(p3.Y()-p4.Y())/3 ], [p3.X()-(p3.Y()-p4.Y())/3, p3.Y()+(p3.X()-p4.X())/3] ]; board.create("polygon", pointList, { fixed:true, highlight:false, fillColor:"red", borders:{ fixed:true, highlight:false, strokeColor:"red" }, vertices:{ visible:false } }); [[/jsxgraph]]


(a) Find the scale factor of the transformation.

[[input:ans1]] [[validation:ans1]]

(1)

[[feedback:prt1]]


(b) Find the centre of enlargement of the transformation.

\((\)[[input:ans2]]\(,\) [[input:ans3]]\()\) [[validation:ans2]] [[validation:ans3]]

(2)

[[feedback:prt2]]

prtcorrect.text: Correct answer, well done.

prtpartiallycorrect.text: Your answer is partially correct.

prtincorrect.text: Incorrect answer.

truefeedback.text:
Here is a worked solution:

The scale factor of enlargement can be determined by comparing the length of any similar sides of the two shapes:


[[jsxgraph height="350px" width="350px"]] var largeCoord1 = [{#first(largeCen)+first(largeOri)#},{#second(largeCen)+second(largeOri)#}]; var largeCoord2 = [{#first(largeCen)+(if abs(first(largeOri))=3 then -first(largeOri) else first(largeOri))#},{#second(largeCen)+(if abs(second(largeOri))=3 then -second(largeOri) else second(largeOri))#}]; var cenPoint = {#tans2#}; var scaleFact = {#tans1#}; var smallCoord1 = [ cenPoint[0]*(1-1/scaleFact)+largeCoord1[0]/scaleFact, cenPoint[1]*(1-1/scaleFact)+largeCoord1[1]/scaleFact, ]; var smallCoord2 = [ cenPoint[0]*(1-1/scaleFact)+largeCoord2[0]/scaleFact, cenPoint[1]*(1-1/scaleFact)+largeCoord2[1]/scaleFact, ]; JXG.Options.text.useMathJax=true; var board = JXG.JSXGraph.initBoard(divid, { boundingBox:[-7,7,7,-7], showCopyright:false, showNavigation:false, keepaspectratio:true, axis:true }); // Small Shape var p1 = board.create("point", smallCoord1, {visible:false}); var p2 = board.create("point", smallCoord2, {visible:false}); var pointList = [ p1, p2, [p2.X()-(p1.Y()-p2.Y())/3, p2.Y()+(p1.X()-p2.X())/3], [ p2.X()+(p1.X()-p2.X())/3-(p1.Y()-p2.Y())/3, p2.Y()+(p1.X()-p2.X())/3+(p1.Y()-p2.Y())/3 ], [ p2.X()+(p1.X()-p2.X())/3-2*(p1.Y()-p2.Y())/3, p2.Y()+2*(p1.X()-p2.X())/3+(p1.Y()-p2.Y())/3 ], [ p1.X()-(p1.X()-p2.X())/3-2*(p1.Y()-p2.Y())/3, p1.Y()+2*(p1.X()-p2.X())/3-(p1.Y()-p2.Y())/3 ], [ p1.X()-(p1.X()-p2.X())/3-(p1.Y()-p2.Y())/3, p1.Y()+(p1.X()-p2.X())/3-(p1.Y()-p2.Y())/3 ], [p1.X()-(p1.Y()-p2.Y())/3, p1.Y()+(p1.X()-p2.X())/3] ]; board.create("polygon", pointList, { fixed:true, highlight:false, fillColor:"blue", borders:{ fixed:true, highlight:false, strokeColor:"blue" }, vertices:{ visible:false } }); // Large Shape var p3 = board.create("point", largeCoord1, {visible:false}); var p4 = board.create("point", largeCoord2, {visible:false}); var pointList = [ p3, p4, [p4.X()-(p3.Y()-p4.Y())/3, p4.Y()+(p3.X()-p4.X())/3], [ p4.X()+(p3.X()-p4.X())/3-(p3.Y()-p4.Y())/3, p4.Y()+(p3.X()-p4.X())/3+(p3.Y()-p4.Y())/3 ], [ p4.X()+(p3.X()-p4.X())/3-2*(p3.Y()-p4.Y())/3, p4.Y()+2*(p3.X()-p4.X())/3+(p3.Y()-p4.Y())/3 ], [ p3.X()-(p3.X()-p4.X())/3-2*(p3.Y()-p4.Y())/3, p3.Y()+2*(p3.X()-p4.X())/3-(p3.Y()-p4.Y())/3 ], [ p3.X()-(p3.X()-p4.X())/3-(p3.Y()-p4.Y())/3, p3.Y()+(p3.X()-p4.X())/3-(p3.Y()-p4.Y())/3 ], [p3.X()-(p3.Y()-p4.Y())/3, p3.Y()+(p3.X()-p4.X())/3] ]; board.create("polygon", pointList, { fixed:true, highlight:false, fillColor:"red", borders:{ fixed:true, highlight:false, strokeColor:"red" }, vertices:{ visible:false } }); var lineStyle = { fixed:true, highlight:false, strokeColor:"#00df25", strokeWidth:3, }; board.create("segment", [largeCoord1, largeCoord2], lineStyle); board.create("segment", [smallCoord1, smallCoord2], lineStyle); [[/jsxgraph]]


Comparing the similar green lengths of each shape, the red shape has width \(6\), and the blue shape has width \({@6/tans1@}\).

Therefore, the scale factor of enlargement is \(\frac{6}{{@6/tans1@}} = {@tans1@}\)

You have found the scale factor of the enlargement of the red shape to the blue shape.
However, you should have found the scale factor of the transformation from blue to red.

Here is a worked solution:

The centre of enlargement can be determined by drawing lines between similar points on the shapes and finding the intersection of these lines.


[[jsxgraph height="350px" width="350px"]] var largeCoord1 = [{#first(largeCen)+first(largeOri)#},{#second(largeCen)+second(largeOri)#}]; var largeCoord2 = [{#first(largeCen)+(if abs(first(largeOri))=3 then -first(largeOri) else first(largeOri))#},{#second(largeCen)+(if abs(second(largeOri))=3 then -second(largeOri) else second(largeOri))#}]; var cenPoint = {#tans2#}; var scaleFact = {#tans1#}; var smallCoord1 = [ cenPoint[0]*(1-1/scaleFact)+largeCoord1[0]/scaleFact, cenPoint[1]*(1-1/scaleFact)+largeCoord1[1]/scaleFact, ]; var smallCoord2 = [ cenPoint[0]*(1-1/scaleFact)+largeCoord2[0]/scaleFact, cenPoint[1]*(1-1/scaleFact)+largeCoord2[1]/scaleFact, ]; JXG.Options.text.useMathJax=true; var board = JXG.JSXGraph.initBoard(divid, { boundingBox:[-7,7,7,-7], showCopyright:false, showNavigation:false, keepaspectratio:true, axis:true }); // Small Shape var p1 = board.create("point", smallCoord1, {visible:false}); var p2 = board.create("point", smallCoord2, {visible:false}); var pointList = [ p1, p2, [p2.X()-(p1.Y()-p2.Y())/3, p2.Y()+(p1.X()-p2.X())/3], [ p2.X()+(p1.X()-p2.X())/3-(p1.Y()-p2.Y())/3, p2.Y()+(p1.X()-p2.X())/3+(p1.Y()-p2.Y())/3 ], [ p2.X()+(p1.X()-p2.X())/3-2*(p1.Y()-p2.Y())/3, p2.Y()+2*(p1.X()-p2.X())/3+(p1.Y()-p2.Y())/3 ], [ p1.X()-(p1.X()-p2.X())/3-2*(p1.Y()-p2.Y())/3, p1.Y()+2*(p1.X()-p2.X())/3-(p1.Y()-p2.Y())/3 ], [ p1.X()-(p1.X()-p2.X())/3-(p1.Y()-p2.Y())/3, p1.Y()+(p1.X()-p2.X())/3-(p1.Y()-p2.Y())/3 ], [p1.X()-(p1.Y()-p2.Y())/3, p1.Y()+(p1.X()-p2.X())/3] ]; board.create("polygon", pointList, { fixed:true, highlight:false, fillColor:"blue", borders:{ fixed:true, highlight:false, strokeColor:"blue" }, vertices:{ visible:false } }); // Large Shape var p3 = board.create("point", largeCoord1, {visible:false}); var p4 = board.create("point", largeCoord2, {visible:false}); var pointList = [ p3, p4, [p4.X()-(p3.Y()-p4.Y())/3, p4.Y()+(p3.X()-p4.X())/3], [ p4.X()+(p3.X()-p4.X())/3-(p3.Y()-p4.Y())/3, p4.Y()+(p3.X()-p4.X())/3+(p3.Y()-p4.Y())/3 ], [ p4.X()+(p3.X()-p4.X())/3-2*(p3.Y()-p4.Y())/3, p4.Y()+2*(p3.X()-p4.X())/3+(p3.Y()-p4.Y())/3 ], [ p3.X()-(p3.X()-p4.X())/3-2*(p3.Y()-p4.Y())/3, p3.Y()+2*(p3.X()-p4.X())/3-(p3.Y()-p4.Y())/3 ], [ p3.X()-(p3.X()-p4.X())/3-(p3.Y()-p4.Y())/3, p3.Y()+(p3.X()-p4.X())/3-(p3.Y()-p4.Y())/3 ], [p3.X()-(p3.Y()-p4.Y())/3, p3.Y()+(p3.X()-p4.X())/3] ]; board.create("polygon", pointList, { fixed:true, highlight:false, fillColor:"red", borders:{ fixed:true, highlight:false, strokeColor:"red" }, vertices:{ visible:false } }); var lineStyle = { fixed:true, highlight:false, strokeColor:"purple", strokeWidth:2, dash:3 } var lineA = board.create("line", [largeCoord1, smallCoord1], lineStyle); var lineB = board.create("line", [largeCoord2, smallCoord2], lineStyle); board.create("intersection", [lineA, lineB], { fixed:true, highlight:false, fillColor:"#00df25", strokeColor:"#00df25", name:" " }) [[/jsxgraph]]


The intersection of these lines shows that the centre of enlargement is \(({@first(tans2)@}, {@second(tans2)@})\)

You seem to have given your coordinates the wrong way around.
Remember that the first coordinate represents the position along the horizontal, \(x\), axis and the second coordinate represents the position along the vertical, \(y\), axis.
Your answer for the \(x\) coordinate of the centre of enlargement is correct.

falsefeedback.text: Your answer for the \(x\) coordinate of the centre of enlargement is incorrect.

truefeedback.text: Your answer for the \(y\) coordinate of the centre of enlargement is correct.

falsefeedback.text: Your answer for the \(y\) coordinate of the centre of enlargement is incorrect.

qtest.description: Test case assuming the teacher's input gets full marks.
